abstract.p: British Health Secretary Alan Milburn resigns citing family concerns and Prime Minister Tony Blair moves John Reid, House of Commons leader, into his position; additionally, Lord Chancellor Derry Irvine retires; Blair uses opportunity to announce institution of new department of consitutional affairs to replace historic position Irvine held as head of judiciary (S)

block.p: One of Prime Minister Tony Blair's closest ministers, John Reid, the leader of the Commons, replaced another Blair ally, Alan Milburn, as health secretary in a cabinet shake-up that also ends the historic post of lord chancellor. Lord Irvine, the current lord chancellor, announced his retirement, and Mr. Blair used the opportunity to incorporate the ancient office's responsibility for the judiciary into a new department of constitutional affairs. Mr. Milburn attributed his surprise decision to resign to family reasons. Peter Hain, now secretary for Wales, succeeds Mr. Reid.
